title: get rid of: [WARNING] [io.quarkus.config] Unrecognized configuration key
body:
### Description

for a compact configuration property file (application.properties) it would be nice to extend already used sections with custom config keys. this is supported by quarkus but throws the following warning: [WARNING] [io.quarkus.config] Unrecognized configuration key ...

for example:

quarkus.restclient."myrestclient".mycustomproperty=myvalue

warning:

[WARNING] [io.quarkus.config] Unrecognized configuration key "quarkus.restclient."myrestclient".mycustomproperty" was provided; it will be ignored; verify that the dependency extension for this configuration is set or that you did not make a typo

this warning would make sense if the application is not intended for using such a key. so it would be nice, when the application can define its whish to extend already existing config sections with app specific config keys, like the extension do that introduced this section.




### Implementation ideas

_No response_
